stories.text: I'd like to demonstrate (for a university class that I'm teaching) what you can find out about your/an android phone from a simple html-page with some java-script (i.e. Battery status, IP-Adress, etc.). Is there a project that shows all the available data on one page (no obfuscation, secrecy, etc. needed)? Note: iPhone Information is okay, too, but afaik delivers much less (reliable) data.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to extract the most data via Chrome/Firefox browser on Android?
Is remote work a benefit worth pursuing?

stories.text: I have the chance to move from my engineering career (full-stack robotics, software engineering, cloud background) to assist a law firm as a patent agent in my respective fields. Has anyone made this transition who can offer some input on how that transition played out and what they learned?
stories.title: Ask HN: Who has changed careers from engineer to patent agent/lawyer?
Yet Another Telecom-Backed Think Tank Insists U.S. Broadband Is Great
Solving Open Source Supply Chain Security for the PHP Ecosystem
How do you know your therapist is right for you?

stories.text:
I’m curious why Finder hasn’t been renamed to Files, or vice versa.

While switching between devices and using iCloud sync more, I’ve noticed the naming/branding gap more often. Example, accidentally searching for Finder on iOS or Files on macOS (spotlight).

Would be similar to Dropbox having different names based on device type. Most companies strive to stay on brand. I’m curious of the reasons for keeping them separate?

My first thought is possibly legacy, explicit references to Finder (scripting/automation/3rd party apps).

Thoughts? Curious if there is a plan to consolidate naming or keep them separate.
stories.title: Ask Apple: Rename Finder to Files?
